issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description: When using s3curl (https://github.com/eucalyptus/s3curl) with either --createBucket or --put /dev/null to do bucket creation, and a bucket name is not specified, Eucalyptus Walrus either hangs (when using --createBucket) or returns errors that are different that what is experienced when  running the test against AWS S3.
fields.summary: Using s3curl, creatingBucket without a bucket name hangs indefinitely and a Java Exception; doesn't produce meaningful error message when using --put /dev/null method for bucket creation

comments.body: *using "--createBucket -- -s -v http://walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/Walrus/" method against Walrus"* {code} # ./s3curl-euca.pl --id admin --createBucket -- -s -v http://walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/services/Walrus/ | xmlindent* About to connect() to walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com port 8773 (#0) * Trying 192.168.39.102... connected * Connected to walrus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com (192.168.39.102) port 8773 (#0) > PUT /services/Walrus/ HTTP/1.1 > User-Agent: curl/7.19.7 (x86_64-redhat-linux-gnu) libcurl/7.19.7 NSS/3.13.1.0 Issue confirmed.  Refer to comments for examples.

*Update*

This was also confirmed by using boto in the eutester case bucket_tests.py.  Refer to the following pull request:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eutester/pull/91
